headline.main: Census Director Marvels at the New Portrait of America

lead_paragraph: KENNETH PREWITT is tired of the Beltway analysis of the Census Bureau's numbers, all the yada yada about how the figures will change the House or rejigger Congressional districts. ''Everyone wants to talk about winning and losing,'' Mr. Prewitt, the director of the Census Bureau, said a few days ago. His office had just issued the decennial tally showing that there were about 281 million people in the country.
abstract: Kenneth Prewitt, director of Census Bureau, says he is less interested in recently issued decennial tally showing that 281 million people live in United States than in fact that 21st century will be century in which United States redefines itself as first country in world history which is literally made up of every part of world; photo (M)
